definition: Ai Qing (1910-1996), Chinese poet
Chinese mugwort or wormwood/moxa/to stop or cut short/phonetic "ai" or "i"/abbr. for 艾滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4], AIDS
surname Ai
to mow/to cut/to reap/to redress
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)

sentences.english: Real poem is a central category of AI Qing s poetry theory.
sentences.chinese: “真正的詩”是艾青詩歌理論的一個核心範疇。

sentences.english: Real poem is a central category of AI Qing's poetry theory.
sentences.chinese: “真正的詩”是艾青詩歌理論的一個核心範疇。

sentences.english: It then summarizes the specific connotations of Ai's concept of "poetry as beautiful prose".
sentences.chinese: 文章最後總結出艾青的“詩的散文美”的具體含義。

definition: Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋

Zhu Ziqing (1898-1948), poet and essayist

Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party

bard/poet
